docs.lead_paragraph: Judges looking into possible corruption at the formerly state-owned French oil company Elf Aquitaine have notified a former French finance minister that he is being investigated in connection with payments made to his secretary, his lawyer said today. The former finance minister, Dominique Strauss-Kahn, considered one of the architects of France's economic recovery, was forced to resign last year because of accusations of corruption in an unrelated matter involving fees he was paid by a student health fund.

headline.main: Ex-Official In France Again Faces Investigation

docs.abstract: Dominique Strauss-Kahn, a former French finance minister, is being investigated in connection with $29,000 that his secretary, Evelyne Duval, received from the oil company Elf Aquitaine in 1993 (M)
docs.snippet: Judges looking into possible corruption at the formerly state-owned French oil company Elf Aquitaine have notified a former French finance minister that he is being investigated in connection with payments made to his secretary, his lawyer said...
